data.title: What Happened on August 10, 1979
data.meta_description: What happened on August 10, 1979. Browse historical events, famous birthdays and notable deaths from Aug 10, 1979 or search by date, day or keyword.
data.text:
Historical Events

Off the Wall

"Off the Wall" 5th studio album by Michael Jackson is released (Billboard Album of the Year 1980)

Ecuador adopts its 17th constitution, extending citizenship and suffrage to all Ecuadorians over 18

Wings release single "Getting Closer" & "Baby's Request"

Famous Birthdays

Dinusha Fernando, Sri Lankan cricketer

Ted Geoghegan, American filmmaker of horror and author, born in Beaverton, Oregon

Yannick Schroeder, French racing driver

Famous Deaths

John Nicholas "Dick" Foran, American actor (OK Crackerby, Fort Apache, Winners of the West), dies at 69

Walther Gerlach, German physicist who, with Otto Stern, co-discovered spin quantization in a magnetic field (Sternâ€“Gerlach effect), dies at 90

Died in 1979 1979 Highlights

About August 10, 1979

Day of the Week: Friday

How Long Ago? 45 years and 1 day

Leap Year: No

Generation: Generation X

Chinese Zodiac: Goat/Sheep

Star Sign: Leo

Music Charts

#1 Song: Bad Girls - Donna Summer

#1 Song: I Don't Like Mondays - Boomtown Rats
